I believe that a number of issues are to be considered in regard to a pregnant woman's health. 
 
 How damaging to her health would continuation of the pregnancy be?

 This question is the one that I think we all need to clarify as to what degree of damage would be considered too high. For example, most women who go through pregnancy end up having a changed metabolism that makes it harder to keep off weight gain. That can be considered a health issue, though most of us (who support some level of third trimester abortion restrictions) would not consider that serious enough to allow for third trimester abortions. On the opposite end, if there is a high risk of paralysis for continued pregnancy, then I think that most of us would think that is a perfectly valid reason. The trouble mainly lies in the in-between situations.
 
What sort of family responsibilities does she have? Most women, it seems, have family responsibilities of one sort or another, as opposed to men who tend to let family responsibilities go by the wayside.
 
 Is she the breadwinner of the family? If she's disabled, what will happen to her family?
 
 I hate it when men, I presume that most of the trivializers are men, when men trivialize the issue of a woman's health.
